title: Newton's Third Law
description: Professor Walter Lewin uses a gas powered bicycle to prove Newton's Third Law

title: First Law of Thermodynamics
description: The first law of thermodynamics is shown in two different ways

title: Charles's Law
description: Charles's Law, part of the ideal gas equation, is demonstated using a balloon and nitrogen

title: Time Dilation
description: Clocks on a plane and on the ground are compared using Einstein's theory

title: Doppler Effect
description: The Doppler effect is demonstarted by spinning a tuning fork

title: Millikan Oil-Drop
description: The charge of an electron can be found by suspending droplets of oil in an electric field

title: Photoelectric Effect
description: See the difference between visible and ultraviolet light on zinc

title: Rutherford's Gold Foil
description: A modern reconstruction of the famous Rutherford gold foil experiment

title: Franck-Hertz Experiment
description: Professor Byron L Youtz recreates this experiment by shooting electrons through mercury

title: Single Slit Diffraction
description: Professor Boyd F. Edwards demonstartes the double slit experiment with light

title: Young's Double Slit
description: Professor Boyd F. Edwards demonstartes light diffraction through a single slit

title: Simple Harmonic Motion
description: An explanation of a simple mass spring system by Professor Boyd F. Edwards
